feed.title: ~/Dileep/Blog$
feed.subtitle: A personal blog about technical things I find useful. Also, random ramblings and rants...

entry.title: My blogging workflow - no CI :sunglasses:
entry.content:
I have created a new file called “2020-05-05-my-bloggin-workflow-no-ci.md” and added some content into it. The file is opened in visual studio code along with a markdown preview extention panel on the side.

I need to find a way to keep emoji snippest at hand. But it is of low priorty. The snippet is avaialable at Markdown Emoji Gist

Next, i’ll be testing the blog post on mu local machine then bush the latest build onto github.

It will be interesting to see how any CI-CD tool will change the workflow and ease my life.
entry.summary: I have created a new file called “2020-05-05-my-bloggin-workflow-no-ci.md” and added some content into it. The file is opened in visual studio code along with a markdown preview extention panel on the side.

entry.title: A blog post straight from my terminal :alien:

link.title: A blog post straight from my terminal :alien:

entry.content:
Finally, i have found the perfect theme for my blog. I have long procrastinated for starting blogging sharing what i’m learning everyday. I tested many blogging platform including wp and ghost. none of them suited my needs. I tested this configuration of jekyll and github pages as it is free. Plus the workflow suits my daily routine of working with terminal.

Since its my first post, i’ll be testing following content type here

  1. emojis :satisfied:

  2. images

  3. audio
  4. video
  5. gif
  6. url I’m an inline-style link
  7. code snippets 
    def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.('Tom')
  8. twitter post

    Pretty much

    — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) May 3, 2020

  9. mastodon post

  10. Quotes

    “This is a quote which should be followed” Also I think this sentence is quite long. more quote text to come

    • Chris Wayne
entry.summary: Finally, i have found the perfect theme for my blog. I have long procrastinated for starting blogging sharing what i’m learning everyday. I tested many blogging platform including wp and ghost. none of them suited my needs. I tested this configuration of jekyll and github pages as it is free. Plus the workflow suits my daily routine of working with terminal.
